DOC.brief_summary: The long-term goal study build sustainable , community-based outreach program use Korean American community health worker ( CHWs ) promote breast cervical screening among Korean American woman , thereby reduce relate morbidity mortality . The study design determine effectiveness health literacy-focused tailor breast cervical cancer control intervention deliver CHWs . The investigator hypothesize , compare KA woman delay intervention group , KA woman receive health literacy-focused CHW intervention demonstrate : ( 1 ) high level adherence screen breast cervical cancer , ( 2 ) great level health literacy , ( 3 ) high level breast cervical cancer knowledge , ( 4 ) improve decisional balance .
DOC.brief_title: Behavioral Intervention Study Better Breast Cervical Cancer Control Korean American Women
DOC.detailed_description: Despite considerable progress U.S. cancer control past 20 year , certain ethnic minority group continue experience significant health disparity . Recent immigrant include Korean Americans ( KA ) , face unequal cancer burden relate significant language cultural barrier face attempt navigate U.S. healthcare system . KA woman second high incidence cervical cancer nationally experience rapid increase breast cancer incidence . Not breast cervical cancer diagnose significantly later stage white , also least likely racial/ethnic group receive early breast cervical cancer screening . This community-based behavioral intervention design 1 ) evaluate , randomize control trial , effect health literacy-focused cancer control intervention , deliver trained CHWs , primary outcome : mammography Papanicolaou ( Pap ) test screen adherence , sample 360 KA woman , 2 ) test effect propose intervention secondary outcome : level health literacy , breast cervical knowledge , decisional balance , KA sample .
